intro: Prosaptia subnuda, commonly known as the naked leaf prosaptia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, often lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairless, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. Prosaptia subnuda is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
